item.title: ISLR Chapter 3: Linear Regression (Part 3: Other Considerations in the Regression Model)
item.description: 3.3 Other Considerations in the Regression Model 3.3.1 Qualitative Predictors There can be a case when predictor variables can be qualitative. Predictors with Only Two Levels For the predictors with only two values, we can create an indicator or dummy variable with values 0 and 1 and use it in the regression model. The final prediction will not depend on the coding scheme. Only difference will be in the model coefficients and the way they are interpreted.
